Class LessonsData

java.lang.Object
org.knowledge.finder.data.LessonsData
public class LessonsData extends Object
The LessonsData class is responsible for storing and managing lesson structures (titles, subsections, and counts) for a project.

It organizes lessons into sections and subsections with numbering like: 

 # Title 1
 Lesson 1.1
 Lesson 1.2
 # Title 2
 Lesson 2.1 
 ...

This class supports:

  • Automatic numbering of sections and subsections
  • Tracking lesson counts per section
  • Sanitization of input (spaces → underscores)
  • Debug printing of titles, lessons, and counts

  • Constructor Details

    • LessonsData

      public LessonsData(String projectName)
      Constructs a new LessonsData instance for the given project.
      Parameters:
      projectName - the name of the project (will be sanitized)

  • Method Details

    • getSubSection

      public String getSubSection()
      Retrieves the current subsection identifier.

      The subsection is typically formatted as "X.Y", where:

      • X represents the section number
      • Y represents the lesson index within that section
      This value is used to organize lesson content hierarchically.
      Returns:
      the current subsection string (e.g., "2.3")

    • setSubSection

      public void setSubSection(String subSection)
      Sets the current subsection identifier.

      The expected format is "X.Y", where X is the section number and Y is the lesson index. This method updates the internal pointer used for lesson organization.

      Parameters:
      subSection - the subsection string to set (e.g., "3.1")

    • getLessonsCount

      public Map<Integer,Integer> getLessonsCount()
      Returns the mapping of section numbers to their corresponding lesson counts. Each entry represents how many lessons are present in a given section.
      Returns:
      a map of section numbers to lesson counts

    • setLessonsCount

      public void setLessonsCount(Map<Integer,Integer> lessonsCount)
      Sets the mapping of section numbers to their corresponding lesson counts. This replaces the current lessonsCount map with the provided one.
      Parameters:
      lessonsCount - a map of section numbers to lesson counts

    • getProjectName

      public String getProjectName()
      Retrieves the sanitized project name. This name is safe for use in identifiers, file paths, or display.
      Returns:
      the sanitized project name

    • setProjectName

      public void setProjectName(String projectName)
      Sets the project name and applies sanitization to ensure safe usage. Sanitization may remove or replace unsafe characters.
      Parameters:
      projectName - the raw project name to sanitize and store

    • getIsNewSection

      public boolean getIsNewSection()
      Indicates whether a new section was recently added. Useful for triggering layout or formatting changes.
      Returns:
      true if a new section was added; false otherwise

    • setIsNewSection

      public void setIsNewSection(boolean isNewSection)
      Sets the flag indicating whether a new section was recently added.
      Parameters:
      isNewSection - true to mark a new section; false otherwise

    • getTitles

      public Map<Integer,String> getTitles()
      Returns the mapping of section numbers to their corresponding formatted titles. Each entry represents a major section in the project.
      Returns:
      map of section titles

    • getLessons

      public Map<String,String> getLessons()
      Returns the mapping of subsection identifiers to their lesson content. Keys follow a hierarchical format (e.g., "1.1", "2.3") representing the subsection's position, and values contain the associated lesson text.
      Returns:
      map of lessons (subsection → lesson text)

    • setTitle

      public void setTitle(String titleSection)
      Adds a new section title.

      Automatically increments the section number and prefixes the title with it.

      Takes titleSection changes to "# 1. Introduction" by adding "1."

      Parameters:
      titleSection - raw section title (e.g., "# Introduction")

    • setLessons

      public void setLessons(String lessonContent)
      Adds a lesson entry under the current section.

      If a new section was just created, increments to the next "whole" before adding lessons.

      Parameters:
      lessonContent - raw lesson text

    • splitSubSection

      public int splitSubSection(LessonsData.DecimalPoint decimalPoint)
      Splits the current subsection string into its whole and decimal parts.

      The subsection is expected to be in the format "X.Y", where:

      • X is the whole part (section number)
      • Y is the decimal part (lesson index)
      This method parses these parts and updates the internal whole and decimal fields.
      Parameters:
      decimalPoint - specifies which part to return: WHOLE, DECIMAL, or RETURN_NOTHING
      Returns:
      the requested part as an integer, or -1 if RETURN_NOTHING is specified

    • done

      public void done()
      Marks the end of lesson input and finalizes the last section's lesson count.

    • replaceSpacesWithUnderline

      public String replaceSpacesWithUnderline(String input)
      Replace spaces with underline in a string by:
      • Replacing spaces with underline
      • Trimming whitespace
      • Handling null inputs safely
      Parameters:
      input - raw string
      Returns:
      string with underline replacing the spaces in the string

    • replaceUnderlineWithSpaces

      public String replaceUnderlineWithSpaces(String input)
      Replace underscores with spaces in a string by:
      • Replacing underscores with spaces
      • Trimming leading and trailing whitespace
      • Handling null inputs safely
      Parameters:
      input - raw string
      Returns:
      string with spaces replacing the underscores in the string

    • printTitles

      public void printTitles()
      Prints section titles to the console (for debugging).

    • printLessons

      public void printLessons()
      Prints lessons (subsections) to the console (for debugging).

    • printLessonsCount

      public void printLessonsCount()
      Prints the count of lessons per section to the console (for debugging).
